title: Current Projects
name: Current Projects
description: Current projects being undertaken by the staff of the National Park Service Programs HABS, HAER, HALS, and CRGIS

properties.name: Alexandria National Cemetery
properties.description: Alexandria National Cemetery Program: CRGIS CRGIS has created a GIS for the cemetery and is currently Updating new burial locations with GPS. This information is being used to enhance a Cemetery Locator Application for Veterans Affairs. Scope of work entails GPS survey, GIS database construction, GIS application development.

properties.name: Bates Hoist
properties.description: Bates Hoise, Baltimore Museum of Industry Program: HAER A nineteenth century elevator/hoist used to move goods between floors. Formerly installed in a Baltimore structure, it now resides at the Baltimore Museum of Industry. Photographs and dimensions were captured before it was moved. Documentation will consist of drawings (including orthogonal views of machinery and a schematic of the hoist in situ, and a historical report.

properties.name: Bird House, National Zoological Park
properties.description: Bird House, National Zoological Park Program: HABS The Bird House was designed by the city’s municipal architect Albert Harris and built between spring of 1927 and the summer of 1928, with later additions in the 1930s. Construction began on the Great Flight Cage in 1963 and it opened to the public in 1965. The bird house, like the other structures erected at the zoo during the 1930s, represent a distinct era in the Zoo’s history wherein grand scale was matched by a refinement of detail, and the robustness of the architectural presence of the animal houses symbolic of the very health of the Zoo itself. Comprehensive recording - drawings, historical report, large-format photography - is currently underway.

properties.name: Civil War Susquicentennial
properties.description: Civil War Susquicentennial Program: CRGIS CRGIS staff is aiding in the development of the Civil War 150th Anniversay web site through GIS database construction. Civil War battlefields, Civil Rights sites, and Contraband camps locations entered into GIS and QAQC'd, and then imported into the CW150 web site application.

properties.name: Clinton's Ditch Structures
properties.description: Clinton's Ditch Structures Program: CRGIS CRGIS is mapping the “Clinton’s Ditch” structures in the city of Cohoes.

properties.name: Cohoes Lock Wall Recording Project
properties.description: Cohoes Lock Wall Recording Project Program: HAER HAER is using the Leica laser scanner to record the last known remaining “Clinton's Ditch”-era lock walls from Erie Canal locks 37 & 38 (ca. 1825), which are now part of the historic Harmony Mills complex in Cohoes, NY. The City of Cohoes received a Save America's Treasures grant to preserve the site in 2005. HAER will produce measured and interpretive drawings of the lock walls and the associated Harmony Mills power house, and produce a contextual history of the site and its relation to the four eras of canal building in the vicinity, and large format photographs of significant features.

properties.name: Covered Bridges Recording Project
properties.description: Covered Bridges Recording Project Program: HAER and CRGIS This is a multi-year, multi-faceted, interdisciplinary project in partnership with FHWA, running from 2008-2013, to document and treat in other ways, historic covered bridges. Key activities include HAER Documentation; a meeting of national covered bridge experts; Historic Covered Bridge Context Study; updated World Guide to Covered Bridges database; Preservation Guidelines; Historic Covered Bridges Best Practices Conference; Historic Covered Bridges book; and a Howe Truss Study. CRGIS staff is also creating a web site that will include an online database and mapping application to display information about the bridges.

properties.name: Ellis Island
properties.description: Ellis Island Program: HABS HABS staff will document the Recreation Building, Recreation Shelter, Staff House, Island 3 Kitchen, Psychopathic Ward, and a representative Measles Ward.

properties.name: Erie Canalway National Heritage Cooridor
properties.description: Erie Canalway National Heritage Cooridor Program: CRGIS CRGIS staff is mapping structures of the New York State Barge Canal and entering inventoried structures into a GIS. See the National Park Service's site for more information about the National Heritage Cooridor.

properties.name: Evergreen House
properties.description: Evergreen House Program: HABS Evergreen was the home of the Garrett family of Baltimore & Ohio Railroad fame between 1878 and 1942, and the house includes their extensive collections of decorative arts, paintings, and rare books that comprise over 50,000 items. The core of the Italiante Mansion was designed and built, beginning in 1857, by local builder Hogg for the Broadbent family. It was purchased in 1878 by John W. Garrett, president of the Baltimore and Ohio Railroad, for his son, T. Harrison Garrett. Over the years, the house was remodeled and expanded to its current forty-eight rooms in order to accommodate their growing collections.

properties.name: Gillnet Boats Documentation
properties.description: Gillnet Boats Documentation Program: HAER Cooperative project with the Columbia River maritime Museum and Clatsop Community College to document 36" open boats used to catch salmon on the Columbia River. Documentation will consist of drawings by the community college, histories by the Maritime Museum, and photographs by HAER.

properties.name: Grand Canyon Paraschant Projects
properties.description: Pine Ranch, Waring Ranch, and Grand Gulch Mine Program: HALS Pine Ranch is an extensive cattle ranch with significant landscape remains from the early 20th century. Waring Ranch includes 6 sites covering more than 50,000 acres of cattle ranch land on the north rim of the Grand Canyon Parashant National Monument. The HALS team will produce measured drawings, written history and photography to support a Cultural Landscape Report and the ongoing maintenance needs of the park.

properties.name: Gullah Geechee NHA
properties.description: Gullah Geechee NHA Program: CRGIS Assess the strength of association and accuracy of location of Traditional Cultural Properties associated with Gullah/Geechee culture within the National Heritage Corridor. Create a GIS database of the inventory that meets NPS spatial data standards for cultural resources.

properties.name: Harpers Ferry National Historical Park
properties.description: Former Storer College Buildings, Harpers Ferry National Historical Park Program: HABS Storer College is significant as a historically black college, founded in 1865 by the Free Will Baptist Home Mission Society to provide an opportunity for advanced education to African Americans in the post Civil War era. The college operated until 1955, closing in the aftermath of the 1954 Supreme Court Brown vs. the Board of Education decision, calling for school integration. The Storer campus became the property of the NPS in 1960. This year, comprehensive recording will be undertaken of the Lewis Anthony Library built in 1905 as the Industrial Arts building for Storer College and the Bird-Brady House that boarded a number of the teachers. In addition, a historical report will be written for Anthony Hall (Worth Hall), which served originally as the Old Main building for the college. Large-format photographs will also be taken of Anthony Hall, the Free Will Baptist Church, and for Harpers Ferry’s Interpretive Design Center, built in 1969.

properties.name: Maritime Administration
properties.description: MARAD, various Program: HAER A multi-year, multi-ship documentation of historic vessels in the process of being decommissioned by the Marine Administration. The twenty-eight ships include oilers, tankers, troopships, and other ship types. Drawings, photographs and historical reports will be completed for each ship.

properties.name: Maryland Historic Trust
properties.description: Maryland Historic Trust Program: HABS In this next phase of the documentation, sponsored by the Maryland Historic Trust, HABS will photograph sites in Queen Anne’s County.

properties.name: Mather Point
properties.description: Mather Point, Grand Canyon National Park Program: HALS Mather Point (also known as Yavapai Point) is the point of entry into Grand Canyon NP for most visitors. Measured drawings and large-format photography will be completed by a HALS team of two of the 1960s overlook on the south side of the canyon. The documentation will be used as the basis for the renovation of the overlook for accessibility needs.

properties.name: NS SAVANNAH
properties.description: NS Savannah Program: HAER The N/S SAVANNAH, named for SS Savannah, was the first nuclear-powered cargo-passenger ship, built at a cost of $46.9 million, including a $28.3 million nuclear reactor and fuel core. The SAVANNAH is one of only four nuclear-powered cargo ships ever built. She was christened by U.S. First Lady Mamie Eisenhower at the ship's launching on July 21, 1959. Documentation will have measured drawings, large-format photographs, and a historical report.

properties.name: Pacific Scientific Furnace
properties.description: Pacific Scientific Furnace Program: HAER Rocketdyne’s operations at Canoga Park include the use of the government-owned Pacific Scientific Furnace, which is considered eligible for listing in the NHRP for this association with the SSP. Every Space Shuttle Main Engine (SSME) flown on the Shuttle was brazed in this furnace. Comprehensive documentation of the five test stand areas of the PF site, including drawings, large-format photographs, and written historical report.

properties.name: Round Lake Auditorium
properties.description: Round Lake Auditorium Program: HAER The mid-nineteenth century Methodist Meeting Camp of Round Lake has an auditorium in which exists the oldest, largest, intact mechanical action pipe organ in America. This first phase of the project will incorporate written technical history, context and photography that will support a National Landmark Nomination.

properties.name: Santa Susana Field Laboratory
properties.description: Santa Susana Field Laboratory Program: HAER The Santa Susana Field Laboratory is a complex of industrial research and development facilities sparsely situated within a 2,668 acre portion of the Southern California Simi Hills in eastern Ventura County California used mainly for the testing and development of liquid rocket engines for the United States space program from 1949 to 2006, nuclear reactors from 1953 to 1980 and the operation of a U.S. Government-sponsored liquid metals research center from 1966 to 1998. Comprehensive documentation of the five test stand areas of the PF site, including drawings, large-format photographs, and written historical report.

properties.name: Schooner WAPAMA
properties.description: Schooner WAPAMA, San Francisco Maritime National Historical Park Program: HAER WAPAMA, located in Richmond, California, is the last surviving example of some 225 steam schooners that served the lumber trade and other coastal services along the Pacific Coast of the United States. Currently managed by the National Park Service at San Francisco Maritime National Historical Park awaiting possible renovation. The WAPAMA will be extensively documented to provide information and a guide to reconstruction. Approximately 30 sheets of drawings, archival 35mm B/W photographs in addition to large-format photographs, and historical narratives, will be included in the documentation.

properties.name: The Space Environmental Simulation Laboratory & Apollo Mission Control
properties.description: NS Savannah Program: HAER The Space Environmental Simulation Laboratory (SESL), part of the manned spacecraft program of the United States, was designed, built, and used to conduct thermal-vacuum testing for all United States manned spacecraft of the Apollo era. Documentation will consist of measured and interpretive drawings, a detailed historical report, and large-format photographs. Apollo Mission Control Center was used to monitor 9 Gemini and all Apollo flights, Apollo-Soyuz, and all recent space shuttle flights. The center exercised full mission control of Apollo 11, from lift-off at the Kennedy Space Center, through the first landing of men on the moon in July 1969, to splashdown in the Pacific. Laser scanning, drawings, large-format photographs, and a historical report with descriptive data will comprise the documentation.

properties.name: Veterans Affairs: Zablocki
properties.description: Veterans Affairs: Zablocki Program: HABS Established by Congress in 1865 and ultimately encompassing a network of eleven branches across the country, the National Home for Disabled Volunteer Soldiers (NHDVS) established a national system for veteran’s health care. As with others, the Milwaukee site was established during the war by a group of women. They formed the Wisconsin Soldiers’ Home Society and worked to provide care and transitional housing to returning Civil War veterans in Wisconsin. By the fall of 1865 they were able to purchase land and begin planning for construction of a state soldiers’ home, the old main structure currently on site. The Milwaukee complex is one of four such sites currently being considered as a National Historic Landmark. HABS drawings are completed for the theater building, library and director’s house, and still underway for the Old Main Hospital. Historical reports and photographs are complete. This year, HABS will complete the comprehensive recording significant buildings on this site through the documentation of the Chapel (building 12) and the Old Hospital (Building 6).

properties.name: Veterans Lake Dam, Chickasaw NRA
properties.description: Veterans Lake Dam, Chickasaw NRA Program: HAER The project will produce measured drawings, large-format photographs, and a historical report. The dam falls within the boundaries of the Chickasaw National Recreation Area in south-central Oklahoma, approximately 1.5 miles soughwest of Sulphur, OK in Murray County. It is situated on Wilson Creek, a tributary of Rock Creek, and was intended to provide recreational benefits. It was constructed from 1933-36 by the WPA as a memorial to the veterans of WWI.

properties.name: Western MD Railroad
properties.description: Western MD RR Program: HAER HAER is conducting a two year, multi-disciplinary documentation project on the former Western Maryland Railway (WMRY) right-of-way and its related structures between Hancock and Cumberland vicinities, MD (milepost 125 to 160). The team is using a Leica laser-scanner to help measure six Potomac River crossings, three tunnels, and other shorter bridges, tunnels, and related structures for the Chesapeake and Ohio Canal National Historical Park (CHOH).

properties.name: White House Evolution
properties.description: White House Evolution Program: HABS As the culmination of many years of indepth recording of the various components the White House, HABS has been asked to visually portray the evolution of the current structures through a series of interpretive drawings.
